Package gui

Contains the classes that make up the graphical side of the application.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
DiaryFrame This is the GUI class for creating a new diary entry and viewing/editing other diary entries.
EntryPanel EntryPanel is the panel that is displayed in the Day View of a particular day and represents an existing entry, or a reminder for a non-existing entry.
ImageFrame ImageFrame is instantiated whenever the user wants to enter an image entry.
JournalSelectFrame This is the Journal Manager class which is the first graphical interface that appears when the user runs the program.
LocationEntryPanel This is the GUI class that creates a panel with 2 text labels (for location name and coordinates) and 4 buttons (map, save, delete, edit).
MainGUI This is the main frame of the application.
MessageFrame This class is used to display a message to the user that explains how to use the application.
MoodChartFrame MoodChartFrame displays a bar chart with the information based on the mood entries of the journal.
MoodFrame This is the GUI class for creating a new mood entry.
NewJournalFrame Frame that prompts the user to enter a name for their new journal.
PlaceFrame This is the GUI class for entering places where you have been.
PlacesEntryMapFrame This class is the GUI for the map that gets the coordinates of a user-set location.
PreferenceFrame Frame which allows the user to select their preferences for the Journal such as the order in which entries appear and which entries should trigger reminders.
TagCloudFrame Implementing a tag cloud for topics entered by the user
TopicEntryPanel This is the GUI class that creates a panel with 2 text labels (for location name and coordinates) and 4 buttons (map, save, delete, edit).
TopicFrame This is the GUI class for entering,viewing and editing the topics entered by a user on a date.
TwitterConfirmFrame Frame that is shown whenever the user presses the tweet button for any entry.
TwitterFrame This class creates a Frame so that the user can enter the PIN necessary to start using Twitter
 

Package gui Description

Contains the classes that make up the graphical side of the application. This includes the main gui class titled (very originally) MainGUI, the journal manager, and classes used to display each type entry. It also contains other frames that are displayed throughout the application.
